text: Comontorius was a Celtic king in Thrace who in 278 BC founded the kingdom of Tylis, imposing a tribute on the city of Byzantium. His successor on the throne was Cavarus under whom Tylis was destroyed by the Thracians in 212 BC.Polybius IV 46. ==References== Category:Gaulish rulers Category:Ancient Thrace Category:3rd-century BC people Category:Celts
title: Comontorius
